sub_topic: Calculation of coefficient of performance of a heat pump
message_1: A heat pump is used to maintain a room temperature of 20°C while the outside temperature is 3°C. The heat pump moves 1500 J of heat from the outside environment to the inside for every 1000 J of work done. What is the coefficient of performance of the heat pump?
message_2:
The coefficient of performance (COP) of a heat pump is defined as the ratio of the heat energy transferred to the inside (Q_in) to the work done (W) by the heat pump. Mathematically, it can be expressed as:

COP = Q_in / W

In this problem, we are given that the heat pump moves 1500 J of heat from the outside environment to the inside (Q_in = 1500 J) for every 1000 J of work done (W = 1000 J).

Now, we can calculate the coefficient of performance:

COP = Q_in / W
COP = 1500 J / 1000 J

COP = 1.5

So, the coefficient of performance of the heat pump is 1.5.
